snippet: The move came after Azerbaijan asked for a steep increase in rent for the Gabala station, which can detect missile launchings throughout the Middle East.
abstract: Russian government says it will shut down operations at major radar station in Gabala,  Azerbaijan, that can detect missile launchings throughout Middle East after failing to reach agreement on new lease with Azeri government, which asked for steep increase in rent.
lead_paragraph: The move came after Azerbaijan asked for a steep increase in rent for the Gabala station, which can detect missile launchings throughout the Middle East.

headline.seo: Russia to Pull Out of Radar Station in Azerbaijan
headline.main: Russia to Close Radar Station in Azerbaijan
headline.print_headline: Russia to Close Radar Station in Azerbaijan
